column3: A National Tobacco Control Coalition was established on 14 December 2009 at the First National Tobacco Conference. Members include representatives of the relevant Ministries non-government organizations and the national Parliament. The Coalition was established to raise public awareness and bring the tobacco control agenda to the forefront of the national politics.

column2: The European Union (EU) is a Party to the FCTC since 30 June 2005. Due to its nature as a regional economic integration organisation the EU only reports on matters which are regulated at EU level on non-binding EU recommendations on activities carried out at EU level or on data which have been collected at EU level. EU legislation exists for example on tobacco product regulation tobacco advertising and tobacco excise duties. Other areas for example smoke free environments cessation aids education fall mainly into the responsibility of the individual EU Member States which are Parties to the FCTC and are reported by them.

column2: The current inflow of donor agencies is interfering with coordination at country level and is threatening the cohesion Parties have established in the years past. It is also important to require donors to declare what they have contributed to Parties and the outcome measured and reported by Parties as well as Donors.

An important issue to highlight is the need for financial support for bodies such as the National Tobacco Control Program. In our case for example. the ending of an international grant in 2013 meant that most of our activities in tobacco control that involve additional costs were limited. It is necessary to highlight the need for sustainable funding and support. whether from international bodies or through the state.

column3:
En el mediano plazo la Secretaría de Salud a través del Centro Nacional para la Prevención el Control de las Adicciones habrá de consolidar un sistema de monitoreo del impacto de las políticas públicas para el control del tabaco de acuerdo a lo establecido en la estrategia MPower que la Organización Mundial de la Salud desarrolló para la implementación del CMCT. 
Este sistema de monitoreo permitirá conocer con oportunidad el comportamiento de la epidemia del tabaquismo a nivel nacional regional estatal y municipal y su prevalencia por género y grupos de edad entre otros. Así mismo será determinante para medir el impacto de las políticas públicas para el control del tabaco aportando información relativa a los volúmenes y el comportamiento de la producción importación y exportación de los productos del tabaco y de la hoja del tabaco; la participación del mercado legal e ilegal de los productos del tabaco; la morbi-mortalidad y los costos asociados a la atención médica de las enfermedades asociadas al consumo de estos productos; entre otros.

Four decisions were issued in 2011-2012 in the Kingdom. These are as follows: 
1 - prohibit the sale of tobacco products to minors 
2 - ban the marketing and sale of electronic cigarette 
3 - prohibition of all forms of smoking in the Kingdom 
4 - start the work concerning the application of pictorial warnings on tobacco packs.

1 - tobacco products who do not smoke: 
A - Product filter cigarettes: There are five kinds of taxes: 
 1 - Tax quality: value of 5705 Syrian pounds kilogram-based tobacco factory 
 2 - value added tax: 33% rate the basis of the retail price 
 3 - tax net profit: average of 35% the basis of net profit. 
 4 - tax consumer spending: average of 15% based for imports: Price 
  Import and customs duties the basis for local production: the retail price. 
 5 - customs duties: an average 23.5% the basis of which the import price. 
2 - Products Smokeless tobacco: Not common in Syria. 
3 - other tobacco products: a tobacco Alorkilp. The types of tax rate or value and the tax base is the same as mentioned above for the cigarette filter.
